abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery Credit Project is
            an essential component of IDA's assistance strategy for
            Yemen. This strategy aims to support: 1) economic
            stabilization; 2) structural reforms; 3) social protection;
            4) improved portfolio implementation and the sustainability
            of past and future investments; and 5) sustainable
            development, with a focus on the management of water,
            population growth, and human resource development. The main
            objectives of this project are to: (a) support the
            Government's stabilization and structural reform
            program; (b) improve the incentives framework for private
            sector development; and (c) ease the shortage of foreign
            exchange needed to finance critical imports to facilitate a
            supply response. The main reforms to be supported by this
            credit relate to trade liberalization; privatization and
            public enterprise reform; and improvement of the regulatory framework.
